text: Leo Bretholz (March 6, 1921 â€“ March 8, 2014) was an Austrian writer and holocaust survivor. In 1942, he escaped from a train heading for Auschwitz. He has also written a book on his experiences, titled Leap into Darkness. Bretholz died in Pikesville, Maryland from natural causes, aged 93. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1921 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Austrian Jews Category:Austrian writers Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Writers from Vienna
